longDesc: You resist the urge to avert your eyes from the sight of the one true God.
detailedDesc: The sight is for each man a different, a mirror into the true nature of The sight is for each man a different, a mirror into the true nature of each person's body and soul.  At first a proud, bitter old man, but just as easily a gentle extended hand, a smile, and gardens... gardens.

longDesc: The archangel Michael turns and begins to look you over.
detailedDesc: At first you see nothing but a bright and comforting glow; then the At first you see nothing but a bright and comforting glow; then the image sharpens suddenly, and you see a face, eyes, hands, but then that too fades, and you see nothing.

longDesc: The archangel Gabriel smiles, and begins to tell you something.
detailedDesc: Known as the Messenger, it is this angel that has brought the Divine Word Known as the Messenger, it is this angel that has brought the Divine Word to the chosen prophets, and in turn brought the Seal of the Prophets on a miraculous journey to the holy city of Jerusalem.

longDesc: The archangel Raphael looks up and frowns at you in disapproval.
detailedDesc: It is impossible to get a solid glance at the archangel.  He is nothing It is impossible to get a solid glance at the archangel.  He is nothing that is human, and with a mere whisper, he dispels every image that you attempt to create in your mind.

longDesc: Uriel, the angel of darkness, stands here guarding the way forward.
detailedDesc: After the Fall of the bringer of light, the Lord had need for the After the Fall of the bringer of light, the Lord had need for the service of a fourth, and it was this angel, Uriel, that rose to the highest ranks.

longDesc: The cherubin of the blazing sword looks at you and begins to chuckle.
detailedDesc: The monster before you seems to be nothing more than a baby or young The monster before you seems to be nothing more than a baby or young child, wrapped in a glowing white cloth, but as you try to walk past, the beast grins and cackles, drawing its sword and blocking the way.

longDesc: A mad, drunken jester is sitting here, lost in his deepening stupor.
detailedDesc: He is dimly aware of your gaze.  Chuckling softly, you hear him mutter He is dimly aware of your gaze.  Chuckling softly, you hear him mutter something obscure: dragons, the temple, the falling of great empires. He laughs at you and takes another drink.

longDesc: One of the jinn dances in and out of the air before your eyes, taunting you.
detailedDesc: You have heard legends of these creatures, the mischievous little demons You have heard legends of these creatures, the mischievous little demons said to be trapped in lamps and bottles, capable of granting all kinds of powerful wishes.  To you, it looks like nothing more than an annoying little sprite.

longDesc: A slumped, shaking old man stands up and begins to yell at the world.
detailedDesc: He wears a faded uniform, decorated with honors of his own creation, He wears a faded uniform, decorated with honors of his own creation, slackened jaws and pasty white bags sagging under his ugly, hating eyes. A tuft of reckless dark hair scatters across his forehead, and his right hand shakes and shakes.

longDesc: The mad Caliph al-Hakim is here, dissecting a young boy.
detailedDesc: The darkest skin, and eyes so white.  Covered only in a shoddy woolen The darkest skin, and eyes so white.  Covered only in a shoddy woolen tunic, he has not bathed in months nor eaten in days, and yet his smile, so charming.

longDesc: The wayward apostle approaches slowly, extending his arms in a hug.
detailedDesc: You see nothing but the sadness of a man who would sell his own God. You see nothing but the sadness of a man who would sell his own God.

longDesc: Pharoah has been sent here in retribution for a lifetime of evils.
detailedDesc: Richly clothed and postured in arrogance and love of power, he looks at Richly clothed and postured in arrogance and love of power, he looks at you with nothing more than a smirk of contempt.

longDesc: Abu Bakr, first of the Rashidun, mourns over the death of the Prophet.
detailedDesc: You see a simple man, dressed in dark and unadorned robes, bent over and You see a simple man, dressed in dark and unadorned robes, bent over and pensive, reliving the memories of a man he never thought would die.

longDesc: You see Umar, second of the Rashidun, the successors of the Prophet.
detailedDesc: You are amazed at the piety of the man.  He looks at you in sadness, You are amazed at the piety of the man.  He looks at you in sadness, saying: "I do not wish to fight you, but if you refuse the truth of the Word, then I must."

longDesc: The third of the rightly-guided Caliphs, Uthman, stands before you.
detailedDesc: He was chosen as leader by a clique of jealous rivals who could agree He was chosen as leader by a clique of jealous rivals who could agree upon no other.  The memory of the Prophet fading quickly from the minds of the faithful, he could do little, and was in the end killed by his enemies.

longDesc: You have come before Ali, fourth and last of the Rashidun.
detailedDesc: Some view him as the closest to God among all of the Caliphs, the one Some view him as the closest to God among all of the Caliphs, the one most deserving of our respect and reverence.  Still others saw him as a schismatic, a heretic, one to be killed and forgotten.  To look at him now is for you to decide for yourself.

longDesc: You gaze in awe at the most beautiful of all angels, Iblis, the Fallen.
detailedDesc: He smiles calmly, and begins to tell you of the time when he would not He smiles calmly, and begins to tell you of the time when he would not kneel, would not prostrate himself before the first human beings.  And then he gestures at you, smiling, and conjures an image of all the  temptations that will be yours if you in turn but follow him.

longDesc: You pause nervously as a voice whispers at you from over your shoulder.
detailedDesc: There is no physical figure attached to the presence that dominates this There is no physical figure attached to the presence that dominates this place, just tormented laughter, moaning, screaming, and begging.

longDesc: A raging dragon turns to you in violent lust for your soul.
detailedDesc: The serpent of babylon, the aged and violet hued monster that has  The serpent of babylon, the aged and violet hued monster that has  watched all of mankind succumb before its power, turns to you as its last victim.

longDesc: The hell-fire around you is dominated by a massive, burning demon.
detailedDesc: You see nothing but the inexorably red and burning anger of the  You see nothing but the inexorably red and burning anger of the  lord of the underworld that you fear to be your fate.

longDesc: Lying on the ground wrapped in blankets is the most innocent of babies.
detailedDesc: The baby is barely aware of your presence, lost in a sleepy and The baby is barely aware of your presence, lost in a sleepy and contented yawn.

longDesc: You stop in surprise at the sight of a teenage boy staring off to the distance.
detailedDesc: He is young, and has not yet seen the bloodiness of this world.  You follow He is young, and has not yet seen the bloodiness of this world.  You follow his gaze and notice that he is gazing in wonderment at the fullness of the moon.

longDesc: A middle-aged man is here, kneeling in prayer.
detailedDesc: He is tired, the lines of age marking his face, but in his robe,  He is tired, the lines of age marking his face, but in his robe,  kneeling, he is the image of perfect contentment.

longDesc: You are overwhelmed by the presence of a soul that has transcended its body.
detailedDesc: You sense certain tastes and smells, the winds through the gardens. You sense certain tastes and smells, the winds through the gardens. Nothing can explain or describe this perfection, this utter bliss.
